Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior, from top: trace of black band; black-figure decoration consisting of confronting animals (panther on the left, head with neck in added red remaining; of second animal, possibly a deer, only forehead remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 66, pl. 52, no. 233)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 222)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.210) (phase 3)
